item.title: Call to artists: St. Luke's Park
item.description:
The City of Ottawa invites artists to submit their qualifications for consideration to design, fabricate and install permanent artwork in St. Luke�s Park in Centretown. The budget for the commission is $55,000 plus HST. Submissions must be received by mail or by hand no later than Monday March 16, 2015 at 5 pm.

An information meeting for artists will be held on Wednesday, February 4, 2015 from 6:30 to 8 pm at the Jack Purcell Community Centre, Room 201, 320 Jack Purcell Lane at Elgin Street, Ottawa.

For more information, please review Call to artists: St. Luke�s Park at
http://ottawa.ca/en/residents/liveculture/arts-theatre-music/call-artists-st-lukes-park or contact publicartprogram@ottawa.ca

item.title: RESOLUTION 2015: SAW Video celebrates the city's best film makers!
item.description:
SAW Video�s members are a vital part of Ottawa/Gatineau�s media arts community and the driving force of our centre. Join us at the Mayfair Theatre as we bring their talent to the big screen with the 2015 edition of RESOLUTION, our annual screening of new members� work. This eclectic event showcases Ottawa�s vibrant film making scene with something for everyone, including music videos, drama, documentary, animation and experimental video art.

HIGHLIGHTS

* Joan, by Pixie Cram. An experimental and gorgeous re-telling of the Joan of Arc story. A tour de force by a veteran local filmmaker.
* Yellow Magic Schoolbus by Phil Osborne. Monster puppets take center stage in a rollicking, stop-motion music video for local psychedelic-punk band, Street Meat.
* Unseen Ottawa by Canterbury High School student Alex Sutcliffe. An intriguing blend of still photographs of some of our city�s overlooked spaces and �old school� analog video effects and glitches.
* 68 anne�s de l'hiver by Alexander Cruz chronicles the journey of a man's journey from blindness to sight.

For more information, schedule and synopses, please visit:
http://sawvideo.com/event/resolution-2015

DETAILS
Resolution 2015
Thursday February 5th 2015, Doors: 6pm / Screening: 6:30pm
Mayfair Theatre, 1074 Bank Street, Ottawa
Admission $5

SAW Video is a not-for-profit, artist-run media art centre that fosters the growth and development of artists through access to equipment, training, mentorship, and programming. Our mission is to support a diverse community of media artists empowered by technology, programming and the exchange of ideas.

This session will explore the duties, responsibilities and challenges faced by a Treasurer of a not-for-profit organization. In addition to maintaining monthly oversight and report presentations, the Treasurer should be actively involved in setting annual budgets and preparing year-end working papers for audits or financial reviews.

What kind of time commitment should be allocated? Are there financial support services that can help to streamline the organization�s operations? What are the Canada Revenue Agency deadlines that must be adhered to?

Take part in the conversation and contribute your experiences. This session is appropriate for both large and small organizations. In addition to those holding a Treasurer�s position, Managers, Executive Directors, Board and Executive Members will find this session useful.

About the facilitator

http://www.ottawaartscouncil.ca/en/our-programs/oac-events/treasurers-roundtable

Thursday February 5, 2015
6:30PM to 8:30PM

Micaela Fitch Room
Ottawa Arts Council
2 Daly Avenue, Ottawa

Ticket price: $20
Light refreshments will be provided

More information: http://www.ottawaartscouncil.ca/en/our-programs/oac-events/treasurers-roundtable

Register: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/creative-capital-exchange-treasurers-roundtable-tickets-15200853161

Brainstorming Sessions for the the Francophone Community

*The December Francophone Creative Capital Exchange brainstorming sessions have been postponed to February. We will be announcing new dates in the coming week.

The sessions are:

Board Matters
French Brainstorming Session

Finding & Tracking your Money
French Brainstorming Session

item.title: Voyage en Asie à la Galerie d'art Eugène-Racette!
item.description:
Voyage en Asie!

La Galerie d�art Eug�ne-Racette du MIFO vous fait voyager avec l�artiste Denise Levesque.

Artiste peintre � temps plein depuis sa retraite de l�enseignement des arts en 2009, le style unique de Madame Levesque donne du mouvement, du rythme et de l��motion � ses figures humaines, ses paysages et ses fleurs.

L�exposition Asie � c�ur joie comprend une s�rie de tableaux faits � son retour du Tibet, du N�pal et de l�Inde. � Le th�me de l�exposition est celui de la spiritualit� bouddhiste et de l�hindouisme. Les images parlent de m�ditations, d�int�riorisation, de pri�res, de gu�risons, de protections et de partage � explique l�artiste d�Ottawa. Les �uvres sur papier peint � l�acrylique et l�encre de Chine rappelle les tons des paysages d�nud�s du Tibet.

Quoi : Denise Levesque
Exposition : 2 au 27 f�vrier 2015
Vernissage : Le jeudi 5 f�vrier 2015, de 19 h � 21 h
O� : Galerie d�art Eug�ne-Racette | 6600 rue Carri�re, Orl�ans

613 580-2766 | caroline@mifo.net

item.title: IFCO PRESENTS: COOL
item.description:
IFCO PRESENTS: COOL
Friday, February 6th at 7 p.m.
City Hall (Councillor's Lounge) 110 Laurier Avenue West
FREE!

COOL � WHAT�S YOUR MEANING? The Independent Filmmakers Co-operative of Ottawa Inc. (IFCO) invites you to come in out of the cold and enjoy a new batch of Super 8 short films. Ten filmmakers were given 24 hours in which to shoot Super 8mm short films using the theme of COOL. These films will definitely increase your �cool� factor! So bring a friend and drop by for some COOL films!

The Independent Filmmakers Co-operative of Ottawa Inc. (IFCO) is a centre for artists who express themselves using the medium of film. IFCO provides its services on a co-operative basis and has supported the creation of over 400 independent Super 8, 16mm or 35mm film productions by its members.

IFCO encourages a critical discourse in and historical appreciation of film. It strives to develop and support an innovative and diverse Ottawa-based community of artists. The Co-op continues to occupy a prominent position within the Eastern Ontario arts community.

Following the screening, COOL attendees are invited to On the Rocks: Winter in Hokkaido. In 2015, On the Rocks brings you the best in food, drink and art from Northern Japan.

Show your COOL pin and enter for � price! LIMITED PINS AVAILABLE

Call: 613-569-1789

Presented by The Independent Filmmakers Co-operative of Ottawa Inc. (IFCO) in partnership with the Downtown Rideau BIA�s CHILL FACTOR.

In partnership with Winterlude.

item.title: On the Rocks: Winter in Hokkaido
item.description:
Jean Pigott Place, City Hall, 110 Laurier Avenue West
Friday, February 6, from 7:30 to 10:30 pm

Every year for Winterlude, Ottawa Art Gallery throws a party to celebrate winter cultures from around the world.

In 2015, On the Rocks brings you the best in food, drink and art from Northern Japan.

Join us at City Hall on Friday, February 6, from 7:30 to 10:30 pm. Admission is $25 and includes food and drink samples.

Advance tickets can be purchased for $20 on OAG's website until Monday February 2 (5 pm).

www.ottawaartgallery.ca/content/rocks-winter-hokkaido

item.title: Shenkman Arts Centre Brings Winterlude to Orléans
item.description:
Frosty weather won�t keep the residents of Orl�ans from greeting February with gusto. As a partner with Winterlude, the Shenkman Arts Centre will offer a number of events in conjunction with the annual festival. This will be the third year that the Centre has partnered with Winterlude.

F�te Frissons
Saturday, February 7, 2015
8:30 a.m. to 12 noon

Presented by Shenkman Arts Centre and sponsored by Minto Communities.

This annual family fun mini-fest is our signature Winterlude event! Everything is FREE!

This year�s theme is �Frozen�. Children are welcome to come dressed in their favourite �Frozen� character.

* Start the day with a pancake breakfast prepared by Cora�s Breakfast and Lunch Orl�ans and served up fresh to the first 400 people.

* Enjoy performances by Magician Ian Quick, Junkyard Symphony and OYP Theatre School�s presentation of The Ice Princess.

* There will also be arts activities, ice carving and snow painting hosted by Ottawa School of Art Orl�ans.

* Also enjoy face painting, Hip Hop demos and more.

Additional activities presented in conjunction with Winterlude 2015 include:

* Improt�ine (FR): Saturday, January 31 at 3 and 5 pm
* Peter and the Wolf (SOLD OUT): Saturday, January 31, 2015 at 4 pm
* Stef Paquette (FR): Saturday, February 7 at 7:30 and 9:30 pm
* Michel Louvain (FR) (SOLD OUT): Saturday, February 14 at 8 pm
* Felicity Falls (EN): February 15 and 16, 2015, 1:30 pm and 3:30 pm

Shenkman Arts Centre des Arts Shenkman
245 Centrum Blvd., Ottawa (Orl�ans), ON K1E 0A1
General inquiries: 613-580-2787 Tickets: 613-580-2700 Toll-free: 1 866-752-5231

item.title: "Life's Simple Pleasures" - Maria Saracino at the Orange Art Gallery
item.description:
The Orange Art Gallery in Ottawa, Ontario is hosting an exclusive exhibit called "Life's Simple Pleasures". From February 4 to the 22nd, the gallery will be showcasing over 30 figurative sculptures by polymer artist Maria Saracino that celebrate the simplicity and rewards of everyday life. With Valentine's Day landing right in the middle of the exhibit, there will be a collection of works that fall in the "Romance" sub category - after all, romance is one of life's sweetest simple pleasures.

Also included in the exhibit is a series of 20 relief sculptures called "Study of Expression".

Maria will be doing a demonstration and offering some hands-on mini-workshops on Saturday, February 7th from 1-5 pm. Space is limited, please contact the artist at 613-425-1729 or the Orange Art Gallery at 613-761-1500

www.orangeartgallery.ca

item.title: Creative Entrepreneurship and the Maker Movement
item.description:
February 10th - 5:00pm - 7:00pm

Throughout the world, millions of engineers, makers, hobbyists, entrepreneurs and innovators are fueling what has been dubbed as the next �Industrial Revolution.� With the opening of our very own Makerspace, uOttawa students have access to state-of-the-art and low-cost digital fabrication tools such as 3D printing. Learn how this revolution is poised to unleash an unprecedented new wave of creative entrepreneurs and how you can take advantage.

(Free) but registration required:

https://web3.uottawa.ca/01/tsomweb/eventmanagement/html/index.php?action=events.viewDetails&eventId=1864&language=en

Location:
Desmarais Building, Room 4101
55 Laurier Avenue East

item.title: Sweetheart Cocktail for the Arts
item.description:

You won�t want to miss the treats in store at this signature fundraiser for the Ottawa Arts Council.

item.title: COMMON ALIENS / Group Show / La Petite Mort Gallery
item.description:
La Petite Mort Gallery presents

COMMON ALIENS / Group Show
New Artwork & Mixed Media from the Gallery's Archives
Curated by Ross McArthur

Featuring Micheal DeForge (Toronto, Canada), Dave Cooper (Ottawa, Canada), Scooter LaForge (New York), Hayden Menzies (Toronto, Canada) & Graham Robinson (Toronto, Canada).

February 13 - 28, 2015
Vernissage Friday February 13 / 7 - 10pm

Statement:

To live in a community, as we have all experienced, is an act of optimism. The struggle for human connection is beautiful and strange and important. We are each faced with the common task of reaching out toward one another, defying the isolation of our own minds.

Common Aliens brings together a collection of diverse figurative works to populate the gallery with a congregation of familiar strangers; bizarre, vulgar, amplified, deconstructed, careful and arbitrary bodies, not entirely unlike our own and those of the people around us. All the parts of a human are present. We may begin to recognize ourselves in the images, but the connection will always be imperfect. Common Aliens explores and expands that imperfection, inviting a sense of alienation as a tool to investigate the distance between ourselves and the world, and to find comfort in the confusion. - Ross McArthur, 2014

More:
http://www.lapetitemortgallery.com/february-2014-3/

Merci,

Guy Berube
Gallery Director

La Petite Mort Gallery
306 Cumberland Street
Ottawa, ON Canada K1N 7H9
T (613) 860.1555
E guy@lapetitemortgallery.com
W www.lapetitemortgallery.com

item.title: Shishya Sadhana: Celebrating Kathak Legend Pt. Chitresh Das
item.description:
Shishya Sadhana 2015
Monday February 16th, 2015 (Family Day)
Algonquin Commons Theatre
1385 Woodroffe Ave. (Building E)
6:30 PM
Tickets 15$

As a leading Indian arts institute in Canada, Gharana Arts is proud to present the next generation of aspiring artists in this spectacular dance and musical performance �Shishya Sadhana�. Meaning the �true devotion of the student,� this breathtaking concert will present the melodious music of India and captivate audiences with vivid and descriptive dance dramas. In light of the recent loss to the Indian arts world of Kathak dance legend, Pt. Chitresh Das, this performance will be dedicated to his memory.

Featuring the original compositions and choreography from Artists, Kasturi Mishra and Ravi S. K. Singh, highlights of the show include Indian dance and music performances, as well as special Kathak and Tabla arrangements featuring the improvisation of live musicians and dancers on stage.

Presented at the Algonquin Commons Theatre (1385 Woodroffe Ave.), this concert promises to be a highlight for the 2015 arts scene in Ottawa. Tickets are $15, and are available at the Algonquin Commons Theatre Box Office. You can also call (613) 824-5712, or email Gharana.Arts@gmail.com.

Please Support us in promoting this spectacular event!!

Visit our Website: www.GharanaArts.com

item.title: HUB & Spoke & SPIN --Interdisciplinary Arts
item.description:
You are invited to HUB & Spoke, HUB Ottawa's signature networking event, and HUB's first event focusing solely on the arts!

On February 19th from 5:30pm to 8pm, join us for a drink and meet artists in Ottawa from all disciplines. Join us in talking about interdisciplinary art initiatives, getting excited about the creative possibilities of interdisciplinary work, and celebrating art initiatives happening across the city of Ottawa. In addition to hearing speakers from various arts organizations, we will feature a giant interactive map of Ottawa's art initiatives, providing artists with opportunities to create connections between their projects and find ways to collaborate with each other.

HUB is excited to be partnering with the Undercurrents Festival, capping off the evening by travelling to Arts Court to see "SPIN" at 9pm, an interdisciplinary theatre show by Evalyn Parry.

To sign up for the event, follow this link:
www.eventbrite.com/e/hub-spoke-intersection-of-arts-tickets-13594079257

Add your project info to the online invite to include on our Arts in Ottawa map, or just come as an individual to see what's up in Ottawa!

Hope you see you February 19th!
